p: The present distribution area of D. involucrata is confined to mountains with complex topographies surrounding the Sichuan Basin, the westernmost being in the Gaoligong Mountains of northwestern (NW) Yunnan, an extension of the southeastern Himalayas ( Fig. 4A). Though Davidia fossils have been found dating from Pliocene to Early Pleistocene sediments in central Japan 19 20 21, none have survived there ( Fig. 4A).
